message.content: Metonymy is a figure of speech in which a word or phrase is used to represent something else with which it is closely associated. For example, using the term "the White House" to refer to the president or administration of the United States, or using the term "Wall Street" to refer to the financial industry. In this way, metonymy creates a connection between two things that are not necessarily related but have become associated through common usage or cultural context.
